Report the success of the push.

<content lines="1-183">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # setup.sh - Master orchestrator for terminal-custom setup
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | #
  6 | # Usage:
  7 | #   ./setup.sh              # Full installation
  8 | #   ./setup.sh --minimal    # Core setup only (no apps, no godot)
  9 | #   ./setup.sh --skip-vscode
 10 | #   ./setup.sh --skip-qdrant
 11 | #   ./setup.sh --skip-godot
 12 | #   ./setup.sh --skip-apps
 13 | #   ./setup.sh --skip-packettracer
 14 | #   ./setup.sh --help
 15 | #
 16 | # =============================================================================
 17 | 
 18 | set -e
 19 | 
 20 | # Resolve paths
 21 | SETUP_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 22 | SCRIPTS_DIR="$SETUP_DIR/scripts"
 23 | 
 24 | # Source common utilities
 25 | source "$SCRIPTS_DIR/common.sh"
 26 | 
 27 | # =============================================================================
 28 | # Parse Arguments
 29 | # =============================================================================
 30 | SKIP_VSCODE=false
 31 | SKIP_QDRANT=false
 32 | SKIP_GODOT=false
 33 | SKIP_APPS=false
 34 | SKIP_PACKETTRACER=false
 35 | MINIMAL=false
 36 | 
 37 | show_help() {
 38 |     echo "Terminal Custom Setup Script"
 39 |     echo ""
 40 |     echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
 41 |     echo ""
 42 |     echo "Options:"
 43 |     echo "  --minimal           Core setup only (shell, dotfiles, fonts)"

<content lines="1-117">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # common.sh - Shared utilities for terminal-custom setup scripts
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | # Resolve paths
  7 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
  8 | PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"
  9 | BACKUP_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/assets"
 10 | 
 11 | # Colors
 12 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 13 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 14 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 15 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 16 | CYAN='\033[0;36m'
 17 | BOLD='\033[1m'
 18 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 19 | 
 20 | # =============================================================================
 21 | # Logging Functions
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | 
 24 | log_info() {
 25 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
 26 | }
 27 | 
 28 | log_success() {
 29 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[✓]${NC} $1"
 30 | }
 31 | 
 32 | log_warn() {
 33 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[!]${NC} $1"
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | log_error() {
 37 |     echo -e "${RED}[✗]${NC} $1"
 38 | }
 39 | 
 40 | log_section() {
 41 |     echo ""
 42 |     echo -e "${GREEN}${BOLD}>>> $1${NC}"
 43 | }
 44 | 
 45 | # =============================================================================
 46 | # Utility Functions
 47 | # =============================================================================
 48 | 
 49 | # Create directory if it doesn't exist
 50 | ensure_dir() {
 51 |     local dir="$1"
 52 |     if [[ ! -d "$dir" ]]; then
 53 |         mkdir -p "$dir"
 54 |         log_success "Created directory: $dir"
 55 |     fi
 56 | }
 57 | 
 58 | # Check if a command exists
 59 | check_command() {
 60 |     command -v "$1" &> /dev/null
 61 | }
 62 | 
 63 | # Run command with sudo, non-interactive
 64 | run_sudo() {
 65 |     sudo "$@"
 66 | }
 67 | 
 68 | # Install packages via dnf (non-interactive)
 69 | dnf_install() {
 70 |     sudo dnf install -y "$@"
 71 | }
 72 | 
 73 | # Check if running as root (we don't want that)
 74 | check_not_root() {
 75 |     if [[ $EUID -eq 0 ]]; then
 76 |         log_error "Do not run this script as root. Use a regular user with sudo access."
 77 |         exit 1
 78 |     fi
 79 | }
 80 | 
 81 | # Verify backup directory exists
 82 | verify_backup_dir() {
 83 |     if [[ ! -d "$BACKUP_DIR" ]]; then
 84 |         log_error "Backup directory not found: $BACKUP_DIR"
 85 |         exit 1
 86 |     fi
 87 | }
 88 | 
 89 | # Copy file with backup of existing
 90 | copy_with_backup() {
 91 |     local src="$1"
 92 |     local dest="$2"
 93 |     
 94 |     if [[ -f "$dest" ]]; then
 95 |         cp "$dest" "${dest}.backup.$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)"
 96 |         log_warn "Backed up existing: $dest"
 97 |     fi
 98 |     
 99 |     cp "$src" "$dest"
100 |     log_success "Copied: $src -> $dest"
101 | }
102 | 
103 | # Copy directory recursively
104 | copy_dir() {
105 |     local src="$1"
106 |     local dest="$2"
107 |     
108 |     ensure_dir "$dest"
109 |     cp -r "$src"/* "$dest"/ 2>/dev/null || true
110 |     log_success "Copied directory: $src -> $dest"
111 | }
112 | 
113 | # =============================================================================
114 | # Export for sourcing
115 | # =============================================================================
116 | export SCRIPT_DIR PROJECT_ROOT BACKUP_DIR
117 | export RED GREEN YELLOW BLUE CYAN BOLD NC
</content>
</file>
<file><path>README.md</path>
<content lines="1-150">
  1 | # Terminal Custom Setup
  2 | 
  3 | Automated terminal and development environment setup for Nobara 42 / Fedora.
  4 | 
  5 | ## Features
  6 | 
  7 | - **Shell Environment**: Zsh, Starship prompt, Atuin history, Fastfetch
  8 | - **Terminal**: Kitty GPU-accelerated terminal
  9 | - **Fonts**: Nerd Fonts (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
 10 | - **Containers**: Podman & Podman Compose
 11 | - **VS Code**: Installation, extensions, and settings restoration
 12 | - **Qdrant**: Vector database with auto-start systemd service
 13 | - **Godot Engine**: Game engine with VS Code integration
 14 | - **Additional Apps**: Chrome, Dropbox, Discord, Obsidian, Anki
 15 | - **Cisco Packet Tracer**: Network simulation tool
 16 | 
 17 | ## Quick Start
 18 | 
 19 | ```bash
 20 | # Clone the repository
 21 | git clone <repo-url> terminal-custom
 22 | cd terminal-custom
 23 | 
 24 | # Full installation
 25 | ./setup.sh
 26 | 
 27 | # Or minimal (core only)
 28 | ./setup.sh --minimal
 29 | ```
 30 | 
 31 | ## Usage
 32 | 
 33 | ```bash
 34 | ./setup.sh [OPTIONS]
 35 | 
 36 | Options:
 37 |   --minimal           Core setup only (shell, dotfiles, fonts)
 38 |   --skip-vscode       Skip VS Code installation
 39 |   --skip-qdrant       Skip Qdrant setup
 40 |   --skip-godot        Skip Godot installation
 41 |   --skip-apps         Skip additional apps (Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpaks)
 42 |   --skip-packettracer Skip Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 43 |   --help              Show help message
 44 | 
 45 | Examples:
 46 |   ./setup.sh                              # Full installation
 47 |   ./setup.sh --minimal                    # Core setup only
 48 |   ./setup.sh --skip-godot --skip-apps     # Skip Godot and apps
 49 | ```
 50 | 
 51 | ## Project Structure
 52 | 
 53 | ```
 54 | .
 55 | ├── setup.sh                    # Master orchestrator script
 56 | ├── assets/                     # Configuration data and assets
 57 | │   ├── .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 58 | │   ├── .config/                # App configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty)
 59 | │   ├── fonts/                  # Nerd Fonts collection
 60 | │   ├── godot/                  # Godot editor settings
 61 | │   ├── vscode/                 # VS Code settings and extensions
 62 | │   ├── images/                 # Custom assets (fastfetch logo)
 63 | │   └── CiscoPacketTracer*.deb  # Packet Tracer installer (optional)
 64 | └── scripts/
 65 |     ├── common.sh               # Shared utilities and logging
 66 |     ├── core_setup.sh           # System updates, packages, shell, fonts, dotfiles
 67 |     ├── vscode_setup.sh         # VS Code installation and configuration
 68 |     ├── qdrant_setup.sh         # Qdrant vector database with Podman
 69 |     ├── godot_setup.sh          # Godot Engine installation
 70 |     ├── apps_setup.sh           # Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpak apps
 71 |     └── packettracer_setup.sh   # Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 72 | ```
 73 | 
 74 | ## What Gets Installed
 75 | 
 76 | ### Core Setup (`core_setup.sh`)
 77 | - System update (dnf)
 78 | - Packages: zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user, fastfetch, kitty, podman, podman-compose
 79 | - Starship prompt, Atuin shell history
 80 | - Zsh plugins: autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete
 81 | - Dotfiles: .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 82 | - Config directories: starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty
 83 | - Fonts installed to ~/.local/share/fonts
 84 | - Default shell changed to Zsh
 85 | 
 86 | ### VS Code Setup (`vscode_setup.sh`)
 87 | - VS Code installation via Microsoft repo
 88 | - Settings and keybindings restoration
 89 | - Extensions installation from extensions.txt
 90 | - Kilo Code global storage restoration
 91 | 
 92 | ### Qdrant Setup (`qdrant_setup.sh`)
 93 | - Podman container setup
 94 | - Systemd user service (auto-start on boot)
 95 | - Available at http://localhost:6333
 96 | 
 97 | ### Godot Setup (`godot_setup.sh`)
 98 | - Downloads Godot (default: 4.4.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
 99 | - Installs to ~/.local/bin/godot
100 | - Restores editor settings with VS Code integration
101 | - Creates desktop entry
102 | 
103 | ### Apps Setup (`apps_setup.sh`)
104 | - Google Chrome (DNF)
105 | - Dropbox (DNF)
106 | - Discord, Obsidian, Anki (Flatpak)
107 | 
108 | ### Packet Tracer Setup (`packettracer_setup.sh`)
109 | - Converts Ubuntu .deb package for Fedora
110 | - Installs Qt5 dependencies
111 | - Non-interactive installation
112 | 
113 | ## Individual Script Usage
114 | 
115 | You can run individual scripts directly:
116 | 
117 | ```bash
118 | # Run only VS Code setup
119 | bash scripts/vscode_setup.sh
120 | 
121 | # Run only Qdrant setup
122 | bash scripts/qdrant_setup.sh
123 | 
124 | # Install Godot with specific version
125 | GODOT_VERSION=4.3 bash scripts/godot_setup.sh
126 | 
127 | # Uninstall Godot
128 | bash scripts/godot_setup.sh --uninstall
129 | 
130 | # Uninstall Packet Tracer
131 | bash scripts/packettracer_setup.sh --uninstall
132 | ```
133 | 
134 | ## Requirements
135 | 
136 | - Nobara 42 or Fedora-based distribution
137 | - User with sudo access
138 | - Internet connection
139 | 
140 | ## Legacy Scripts
141 | 
142 | Previous installation scripts are preserved in `legacy/` for reference:
143 | - `install.sh` - Original all-in-one script
144 | - `install_apps.sh` - Original apps installer
145 | - `install_godot.sh` - Original Godot installer
146 | - `install_packettracer.sh` - Original Packet Tracer installer
147 | 
148 | ## License
149 | 
150 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.
</content>
